# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return strip(lowercase(replace(col, [" " => "_", "-" => "_"])))
end
```

This function does the following:

1. `strip`: Removes any leading or trailing whitespace from the string.
2. `lowercase`: Converts the entire string to lowercase.
3. `replace`: Replaces both spaces (`" "`) and hyphens (`"-"`) with an underscore (`"_"`).

The function then returns the cleaned column name as a lowercased, space/hyphen-free version of the original string.
